DataElement.preferredName: Stem Cell Transplant HLA Match Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The state or condition of a therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stem Cell Transplant HLA Match Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.:A process in which blood or tissue samples are analyzed to determine their human leukocyte antigen (HLA) profiles so that transplant materials can be transferred into a patient with the same or similar profile.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A method of replacing the immature blood-forming cells lost due to high-dose chemotherapy, and possibly radiation therapy, used to destroy leukemia cells.  The stem cells are given to the patient after treatment to help the bone marrow recover and continue producing healthy blood cells.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.

Property.preferredDefinition: A process in which blood or tissue samples are analyzed to determine their human leukocyte antigen (HLA) profiles so that transplant materials can be transferred into a patient with the same or similar profile.

Concepts.definition: A process in which blood or tissue samples are analyzed to determine their human leukocyte antigen (HLA) profiles so that transplant materials can be transferred into a patient with the same or similar profile.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A process in which blood or tissue samples are analyzed to determine their human leukocyte antigen (HLA) profiles so that transplant materials can be transferred into a patient with the same or similar profile._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._A condition or state at a particular time._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The state when a recipient and their donor have the same alleles for tissue markers. A full match includes HLA-A, HLA-B, HLA-C, and HLA-DRB1. HLA match typing may also include alleles in the HLA-DQ serogroup.

Concepts.definition: The state when a recipient and their donor have the same alleles for tissue markers. A full match includes HLA-A, HLA-B, HLA-C, and HLA-DRB1. HLA match typing may also include alleles in the HLA-DQ serogroup.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The state when a recipient of a hematopoietic stem cell transplant is not fully matched with their donor for HLA-A, HLA-B, HLA-C, and HLA-DRB1.

Concepts.definition: The state when a recipient of a hematopoietic stem cell transplant is not fully matched with their donor for HLA-A, HLA-B, HLA-C, and HLA-DRB1.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.
